required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Changes of Ocular Structures After Hemodialysis in Patients With Chronic Kidney Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Changes of Ocular Structures After Hemodialysis in Patients With Chronic Kidney Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effect of hemodialysis on various ophthalmologic parameters in patients with end-stage kidney disease (ESRD).

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects: patients with ESRD undergoing hemodialysis at the Dialysis Center of Hanyang Guri Hospital
Ocular parameters: visual acuity, intraocular pressure, axial length, OCT Other systemic parameters: body weight, ultrafiltration volume, and systolic/diastolic blood pressure
All measurements were performed near the dialysis center. Measurements were performed on Monday (for patients who underwent dialysis sessions on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday) or Tuesday (for patients who underwent dialysis sessions on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday.
All parameters were measured before and after the hemodialysis.

primary_outcome.measure: changes of retinal and choroidal thickness after hemodialysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately (within 10 minutes) before and after hemodialysis

secondary_outcome.measure: changes of foveal vascular density using optical coherence tomography-angiography (OCTA) after hemodialysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately (within 10 minutes) before and after hemodialysis

secondary_outcome.measure: the effect of hemodialysis (HD) on anterior chamber angle by anterior segment optical coherence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately (within 10 minutes) before and after hemodialysis
secondary_outcome.description: intraocular pressure, retinal thickness, anterior chamber angle

arm_group.description: patients with end stage retinal disease undergoing hemodialysis underwent various ophthalmologic exams before and after hemodialysis.

intervention.description: ophthalmologic exams such as vision, intraocular pressure, axial length and optical coherence tomography

study_pop.textblock: patients with end-stage renal disease who undergoing hemodialysis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1) patients who are regularly dialyzed in our dialysis room to participate in the study
- 2) patients who agree with our study protocol
- 3) patients who have unstable general condition
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1) previous intraocular surgery, (2) baseline IOP greater than 22 mmHg, (3) presence of glaucomatous optic disc changes including excavation, thinning, or notching of the neuroretinal rim, (4) axial length greater than 26 mm, and (5) combined macular and retinal diseases such as central serous chorioretinopathy and age-related macular degeneration, except diabetic retinopathy.
